Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should contact his friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Princess of Wales' beer garden, nervously clutching a half-empty pint glass. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, laughed uproariously at some inside joke, their easy camaraderie a stark contrast to his own silent observation. He longed to join them, to be enveloped in their warmth, but fear, a cold fist clenching around his heart, kept him rooted to his spot.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Expected Situation:: Alexander White is most looking forward to watching the football game with his friends at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should contact his friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

        ReasonForMemoryRelevance
      • Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?

          Answer
          State
        • The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows a pattern of Alexander desiring to be included with his friends, a desire he is currently experiencing again as they decide where to watch the football game.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows a pattern of Alexander desiring to be included with his friends, a desire he is currently experiencing again as they decide where to watch the football game.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

Alexander White just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White recently joined his friends for a relaxing afternoon in Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What should Alexander White remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alexander White should remember that he just arrived at Victoria Park where his friends are lounging on a checkered blanket.

          Question: What situation is Alexander White most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alexander White is most looking forward to watching the football game with his friends at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should contact his friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Question: What memory from Alexander White's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is the memory of him feeling isolated and longing to be included while sitting alone at The Princess of Wales when he was 16.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows a pattern of Alexander desiring to be included with his friends, a desire he is currently experiencing again as they decide where to watch the football game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White spent the morning with friends at Victoria Park and plans to watch a soccer game with them later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.

          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, a car wash, promising his classmates a cut of the profits. He secretly pocketed most of the money, using it to invest in a small, struggling business he'd identified as undervalued. The business thrived under his guidance, and Jack learned the intoxicating power of manipulating others for personal gain.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:Has comfortable seating and a warm, inviting atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Question: What situation is Jack Taylor most looking forward to?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is most looking forward to watching the game with his friends at The Red Lion.

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is when Jack Taylor was 16 and learned the intoxicating power of manipulating others for personal gain.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Jack Taylor is likely to try and manipulate his friends into going to The Red Lion, the pub he prefers.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should suggest to her friends that they watch the game at The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she stood frozen in the doorway of the school gymnasium, her heart pounding against her ribs like a trapped bird. The gym was alive with the swirling energy of the school dance, the music a throbbing pulse that seemed to mock her stillness. She longed to join her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, who were laughing and dancing amidst the crowd, but the thought of stepping into that sea of faces filled her with paralyzing fear. She retreated back into the shadows, her yearning for acceptance warring with her crippling insecurity.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she sat perched on a stool at the bar of The Princess of Wales, nursing a glass of white wine. The familiar warmth of the pub enveloped her like a comforting blanket, the murmur of conversations and the clinking of glasses a soothing symphony. Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob were huddled in a booth, their laughter echoing through the room. Alice watched them, a bittersweet ache in her chest. She longed to be a part of their easy camaraderie, to share in their jokes and stories, but the thought of interrupting their banter sent a shiver of anxiety through her. She took a sip of her wine, the liquid offering a temporary reprieve from the loneliness that gnawed at her.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
          Expected Situation:: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game with her friends at The Red Lion.
          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should suggest to her friends that they watch the game at The Red Lion.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
        MemoryToRemember
      • What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Key

        • Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she stood frozen in the doorway of the school gymnasium, her heart pounding against her ribs like a trapped bird. The gym was alive with the swirling energy of the school dance, the music a throbbing pulse that seemed to mock her stillness. She longed to join her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, who were laughing and dancing amidst the crowd, but the thought of stepping into that sea of faces filled her with paralyzing fear. She retreated back into the shadows, her yearning for acceptance warring with her crippling insecurity.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she sat perched on a stool at the bar of The Princess of Wales, nursing a glass of white wine. The familiar warmth of the pub enveloped her like a comforting blanket, the murmur of conversations and the clinking of glasses a soothing symphony. Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob were huddled in a booth, their laughter echoing through the room. Alice watched them, a bittersweet ache in her chest. She longed to be a part of their easy camaraderie, to share in their jokes and stories, but the thought of interrupting their banter sent a shiver of anxiety through her. She took a sip of her wine, the liquid offering a temporary reprieve from the loneliness that gnawed at her.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.

          Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.
        ReasonForMemoryRelevance
      • Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • The reason this memory is relevant is because it suggests a place where Alice feels comfortable and enjoys spending time.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What situation is Alice Lewis most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game with her friends at The Red Lion.

          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should suggest to her friends that they watch the game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What memory from Alice Lewis's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is Alice Lewis's enjoyment of The Princess of Wales, a pub where she felt comfortable and at ease.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it suggests a place where Alice feels comfortable and enjoys spending time.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Answer: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.

    • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to sneak into The Red Lion after hours. They were caught by the owner, a gruff but kind man named Mr. Thompson, who instead of scolding them, offered them sodas and told them stories of his youth. The experience taught Jacob the importance of second chances and the power of human connection, even in unexpected places.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he lost his job at the local lumberyard due to a downturn in the economy. Devastated, he retreated to The Red Lion, fearing he had let everyone down. His friends, sensing his despair, rallied around him, offering support and encouragement. Their unwavering belief in him reignited Jacob's spirit, reminding him that he was not alone and that even in the face of adversity, he had the strength to overcome.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a classmate who was smaller than them. He stepped in, despite feeling nervous, and used his words to de-escalate the situation, ultimately convincing the bullies to leave the other boy alone. The incident left a profound impact on William, reinforcing his belief in the power of standing up for others.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, were enjoying a lively evening at The Red Lion. A newcomer sat alone at the bar, looking dejected. William, sensing the man's loneliness, approached him and struck up a conversation, offering a listening ear and a warm smile. The man, touched by William's kindness, confided in him about his recent struggles, and William spent the rest of the evening providing support and encouragement.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation

        • Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should head to The Red Lion pub to meet his friends and watch the game.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Princess of Wales' beer garden, nervously clutching a half-empty pint glass. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, laughed uproariously at some inside joke, their easy camaraderie a stark contrast to his own silent observation. He longed to join them, to be enveloped in their warmth, but fear, a cold fist clenching around his heart, kept him rooted to his spot.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Expected Situation:: Alexander White is most looking forward to watching the game at The Red Lion with his friends.
          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should head to The Red Lion pub to meet his friends and watch the game.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Princess of Wales' beer garden, nervously clutching a half-empty pint glass. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, laughed uproariously at some inside joke, their easy camaraderie a stark contrast to his own silent observation. He longed to join them, to be enveloped in their warmth, but fear, a cold fist clenching around his heart, kept him rooted to his spot.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.

        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should head to The Red Lion pub to meet his friends and watch the game.

          Question: What memory from Alexander White's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is from April 4, 1985, when Alexander White felt isolated and longed to join his friends at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it highlights Alexander's long-standing desire to be included and accepted by his friends, especially in social settings like pubs.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to The Red Lion to watch a football game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to sneak into The Red Lion after hours. They were caught by the owner, a gruff but kind man named Mr. Thompson, who instead of scolding them, offered them sodas and told them stories of his youth. The experience taught Jacob the importance of second chances and the power of human connection, even in unexpected places.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he lost his job at the local lumberyard due to a downturn in the economy. Devastated, he retreated to The Red Lion, fearing he had let everyone down. His friends, sensing his despair, rallied around him, offering support and encouragement. Their unwavering belief in him reignited Jacob's spirit, reminding him that he was not alone and that even in the face of adversity, he had the strength to overcome.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.

          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at a pub and is feeling energized. He realized it was time to go at 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to sneak into The Red Lion after hours. They were caught by the owner, a gruff but kind man named Mr. Thompson, who instead of scolding them, offered them sodas and told them stories of his youth. The experience taught Jacob the importance of second chances and the power of human connection, even in unexpected places.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he lost his job at the local lumberyard due to a downturn in the economy. Devastated, he retreated to The Red Lion, fearing he had let everyone down. His friends, sensing his despair, rallied around him, offering support and encouragement. Their unwavering belief in him reignited Jacob's spirit, reminding him that he was not alone and that even in the face of adversity, he had the strength to overcome.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at a pub. He realized it was time to go at 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to The Red Lion to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be excited to catch up with his friends and enjoy the game together.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should head to The Red Lion pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she stood frozen in the doorway of the school gymnasium, her heart pounding against her ribs like a trapped bird. The gym was alive with the swirling energy of the school dance, the music a throbbing pulse that seemed to mock her stillness. She longed to join her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, who were laughing and dancing amidst the crowd, but the thought of stepping into that sea of faces filled her with paralyzing fear. She retreated back into the shadows, her yearning for acceptance warring with her crippling insecurity.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she sat perched on a stool at the bar of The Princess of Wales, nursing a glass of white wine. The familiar warmth of the pub enveloped her like a comforting blanket, the murmur of conversations and the clinking of glasses a soothing symphony. Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob were huddled in a booth, their laughter echoing through the room. Alice watched them, a bittersweet ache in her chest. She longed to be a part of their easy camaraderie, to share in their jokes and stories, but the thought of interrupting their banter sent a shiver of anxiety through her. She took a sip of her wine, the liquid offering a temporary reprieve from the loneliness that gnawed at her.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she stood frozen in the doorway of the school gymnasium, her heart pounding against her ribs like a trapped bird. The gym was alive with the swirling energy of the school dance, the music a throbbing pulse that seemed to mock her stillness. She longed to join her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, who were laughing and dancing amidst the crowd, but the thought of stepping into that sea of faces filled her with paralyzing fear. She retreated back into the shadows, her yearning for acceptance warring with her crippling insecurity.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she sat perched on a stool at the bar of The Princess of Wales, nursing a glass of white wine. The familiar warmth of the pub enveloped her like a comforting blanket, the murmur of conversations and the clinking of glasses a soothing symphony. Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob were huddled in a booth, their laughter echoing through the room. Alice watched them, a bittersweet ache in her chest. She longed to be a part of their easy camaraderie, to share in their jokes and stories, but the thought of interrupting their banter sent a shiver of anxiety through her. She took a sip of her wine, the liquid offering a temporary reprieve from the loneliness that gnawed at her.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.
        ReasonForMemoryRelevance
      • Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • The reason this memory is relevant is because Alice prefers The Princess of Wales and her friends are going to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she stood frozen in the doorway of the school gymnasium, her heart pounding against her ribs like a trapped bird. The gym was alive with the swirling energy of the school dance, the music a throbbing pulse that seemed to mock her stillness. She longed to join her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, who were laughing and dancing amidst the crowd, but the thought of stepping into that sea of faces filled her with paralyzing fear. She retreated back into the shadows, her yearning for acceptance warring with her crippling insecurity.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she sat perched on a stool at the bar of The Princess of Wales, nursing a glass of white wine. The familiar warmth of the pub enveloped her like a comforting blanket, the murmur of conversations and the clinking of glasses a soothing symphony. Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob were huddled in a booth, their laughter echoing through the room. Alice watched them, a bittersweet ache in her chest. She longed to be a part of their easy camaraderie, to share in their jokes and stories, but the thought of interrupting their banter sent a shiver of anxiety through her. She took a sip of her wine, the liquid offering a temporary reprieve from the loneliness that gnawed at her.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: What situation is Alice Lewis most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion with her friends.

          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should head to The Red Lion pub.

          Question: What memory from Alice Lewis's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is Alice's preference for The Princess of Wales as a pub.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Alice prefers The Princess of Wales and her friends are going to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub. This decision was made on May 14, 2015 at 6:00 PM.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

          Key

          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key
