        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a classmate who was smaller than them. He stepped in, despite feeling nervous, and used his words to de-escalate the situation, ultimately convincing the bullies to leave the other boy alone. The incident left a profound impact on William, reinforcing his belief in the power of standing up for others.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, were enjoying a lively evening at The Red Lion. A newcomer sat alone at the bar, looking dejected. William, sensing the man's loneliness, approached him and struck up a conversation, offering a listening ear and a warm smile. The man, touched by William's kindness, confided in him about his recent struggles, and William spent the rest of the evening providing support and encouragement.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could gather his friends and head to The Red Lion pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Red Lion.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a classmate who was smaller than them. He stepped in, despite feeling nervous, and used his words to de-escalate the situation, ultimately convincing the bullies to leave the other boy alone. The incident left a profound impact on William, reinforcing his belief in the power of standing up for others.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, were enjoying a lively evening at The Red Lion. A newcomer sat alone at the bar, looking dejected. William, sensing the man's loneliness, approached him and struck up a conversation, offering a listening ear and a warm smile. The man, touched by William's kindness, confided in him about his recent struggles, and William spent the rest of the evening providing support and encouragement.

        • William Jones, William Jones is currently at The Red Lion pub watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game. He spent the day with friends at Victoria Park.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion

      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should gather his friends and head to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, a car wash, promising his classmates a cut of the profits. He secretly pocketed most of the money, using it to invest in a small, struggling business he'd identified as undervalued. The business thrived under his guidance, and Jack learned the intoxicating power of manipulating others for personal gain.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: What should Jack Taylor remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, a car wash, promising his classmates a cut of the profits. He secretly pocketed most of the money, using it to invest in a small, struggling business he'd identified as undervalued. The business thrived under his guidance, and Jack learned the intoxicating power of manipulating others for personal gain.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go to a pub to watch a game. He realized this at 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What should Jack Taylor remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What situation is Jack Taylor most looking forward to?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is most looking forward to watching the European football cup game with his friends at The Red Lion.

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should gather his friends and head to The Red Lion.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is when Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, a car wash, promising his classmates a cut of the profits.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows Jack Taylor has a history of manipulating others for personal gain, which might be relevant to his choice of pub or his insistence on going to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should propose that her friends meet at The Princess of Wales for the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Expected Situation:: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the game with all of her friends at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should propose that her friends meet at The Princess of Wales for the game.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.

          Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Red Lion.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where she is meeting friends for coffee and pastries. Later that evening, Alice and her friends plan to watch a soccer game between Ireland and Russia at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What situation is Alice Lewis most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the game with all of her friends at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should propose that her friends meet at The Princess of Wales for the game.

          Question: What memory from Alice Lewis's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alice Lewis prefers to watch the game at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Alice Lewis prefers to watch the game at The Princess of Wales, and her friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where she is meeting friends for coffee and pastries. Later that evening, Alice and her friends plan to watch a soccer game between Ireland and Russia at a pub.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where she is meeting friends for coffee and pastries. Later that evening, Alice and her friends plan to watch a soccer game between Ireland and Russia at a pub.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently at a market meeting friends for coffee and pastries. Later today, she plans to watch a soccer game with her friends.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is currently at a market meeting friends for coffee and pastries. Later today, she plans to watch a soccer game with her friends.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to try and convince his friends to go to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, were enjoying a lively evening at The Red Lion. A newcomer sat alone at the bar, looking dejected. William, sensing the man's loneliness, approached him and struck up a conversation, offering a listening ear and a warm smile. The man, touched by William's kindness, confided in him about his recent struggles, and William spent the rest of the evening providing support and encouragement.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends at a park and then went to watch a soccer game, but was disappointed that not all of his friends attended.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones spent time with friends at a park and then went to watch a soccer game, but was disappointed that not all of his friends attended.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a classmate who was smaller than them. He stepped in, despite feeling nervous, and used his words to de-escalate the situation, ultimately convincing the bullies to leave the other boy alone. The incident left a profound impact on William, reinforcing his belief in the power of standing up for others.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, were enjoying a lively evening at The Red Lion. A newcomer sat alone at the bar, looking dejected. William, sensing the man's loneliness, approached him and struck up a conversation, offering a listening ear and a warm smile. The man, touched by William's kindness, confided in him about his recent struggles, and William spent the rest of the evening providing support and encouragement.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.

        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered. They are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What should Jack Taylor remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should remember that he just arrived at a market where his friends are sitting at a long wooden table.

          Question: What situation is Jack Taylor most looking forward to?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is most looking forward to watching the game at The Red Lion with all of his friends.

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they meet at The Red Lion for the game.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game at The Red Lion the night before because not all of his friends were there.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Jack Taylor had a bad experience at The Red Lion the previous night when not all of his friends were present.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered. They are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered. They are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

      • What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Key

        • Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer
          State
        • The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game at The Red Lion the night before because not all of his friends were there.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:Has comfortable seating and a warm, inviting atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that he just arrived at Victoria Park where his friends are lounging on a checkered blanket.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game at The Red Lion the night before because not all of his friends were there.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.

          State

          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows that Alexander White prefers to watch the game with all of his friends and had a negative experience when they were not all together.

      • What situation is Alexander White most looking forward to?

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered, and they are discussing where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What should Alexander White remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alexander White should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What situation is Alexander White most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alexander White is most looking forward to watching the game at The Red Lion with his friends.

          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should suggest going to The Red Lion to his friends.

          Question: What memory from Alexander White's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alexander White had a bad time watching the game at The Princess of Wales the night before because not all of his friends were there.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows that Alexander White prefers to watch the game with all of his friends and had a negative experience when they were not all together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is having coffee with friends and they are deciding which pub to go to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, deciding where to watch a football game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go along with the group's decision and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Answer: Alexander White should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Answer: Alexander White should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What situation is Alexander White most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alexander White is most looking forward to watching the game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What memory from Alexander White's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alexander White prefers to watch the game at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows Alexander White's preference for a specific pub when watching games.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
