2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing experience watching a game at The Red Lion pub on May 14th, but is planning to watch another game there with friends on May 15th.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

The man, touched by William's kindness, confided in him about his recent struggles, and William spent the rest of the evening providing support and encouragement.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that he just arrived at a market where his friends are sitting at a long wooden table.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Relevant Memory:: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor prefers to watch games at The Red Lion.
          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Jack Taylor is about to go watch a game at a pub and he prefers The Red Lion.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What should Jack Taylor remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What situation is Jack Taylor most looking forward to?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is most looking forward to watching the game at The Red Lion with his friends.

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should convince his friends to go to The Red Lion.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor prefers to watch games at The Red Lion.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Jack Taylor is about to go watch a game at a pub and he prefers The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Jack Taylor decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game earlier today and is currently noting the time as 18:00-18:05 on May 15, 2015.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation

        • Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Red Lion.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to watch the game at a pub. She is presumably heading to the pub now.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends decided to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What situation is Alice Lewis most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the game with her friends at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should try to convince her friends to go to The Princess of Wales instead of The Red Lion.

          Question: What memory from Alice Lewis's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alice Lewis's friends decided to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Alice Lewis's friends decided to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Red Lion and are now planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at the same pub.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis realized it was time to watch the game at a pub. She is presumably heading to the pub now.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values friendship.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, fatigued, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing disappointment and loneliness.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in a park and is considering going to a pub to watch a soccer game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feeling somewhat disappointed and lonely.

          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely despite spending time with friends in a park. He is contemplating going to a pub to watch a soccer game.

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in a park and is considering going to a pub to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feeling somewhat disappointed and lonely.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, even though he wishes more of them were there.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt

      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?

        • Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should suggest that everyone meet at the same pub, perhaps by proposing a vote or reminding everyone of the enjoyment they had the first night when they were all together.

          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should suggest that everyone meet at the same pub, perhaps by proposing a vote or reminding everyone of the enjoyment they had the first night when they were all together.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What situation is Alexander White most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alexander White is most looking forward to watching the game with all of his friends at the same pub.

          Question: What actions should Alexander White take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alexander White should suggest that everyone meet at the same pub, perhaps by proposing a vote or reminding everyone of the enjoyment they had the first night when they were all together.

          Question: What memory from Alexander White's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alexander White had a bad time watching the game the previous night because not all of his friends were at the same pub.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alexander White?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it shows that Alexander White prefers when all of his friends watch the game together at the same pub.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.

          Value

Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Alexander White should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?

          Answer

        • To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they meet at The Red Lion to watch the game.

      • Act

        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends. The group is deciding where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What should Jack Taylor remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What situation is Jack Taylor most looking forward to?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is most looking forward to watching the game at The Red Lion with his friends.

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they meet at The Red Lion to watch the game.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game at The Red Lion the previous night because not all of his friends were there.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it explains why Jack Taylor might be hesitant to go to The Red Lion again, especially if his friends are suggesting The Princess of Wales as an alternative.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends. The group is deciding where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game later that evening.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that he just arrived at Victoria Park where his friends are lounging on a checkered blanket.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [recent memory] Jack Taylor should remember that he just arrived at a market where his friends are sitting at a long wooden table.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
          Actions to Achieve Situation:: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they meet at The Red Lion to watch the game.
          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game at The Red Lion the previous night because not all of his friends were there.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Jack Taylor's Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends. The group is deciding where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game later that evening.
          Jack Taylor's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and they are planning to watch the Serbia-Andorra game later. It is currently 10:00-10:05 on May 16, 2015.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and they are planning to watch the Serbia-Andorra game later. It is currently 10:00-10:05 on May 16, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Answer: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales was fun last time, but maybe somewhere new would be nice?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales was fun last time, but maybe somewhere new would be nice?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales was fun last time, but maybe somewhere new would be nice?"
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?
          Memory to Remember:: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are planning to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game at The Red Lion.
          Question: What situation is Alice Lewis most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the game with all of her friends at The Princess of Wales.
        TimeDisplay

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales was fun last time, but maybe somewhere new would be nice?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends who are enjoying the sunshine and snacks. The group is trying to decide where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What should Alice Lewis remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should remember that her friends are planning to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game at The Red Lion.

          Question: What situation is Alice Lewis most looking forward to?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is most looking forward to watching the game with all of her friends at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What actions should Alice Lewis take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Alice Lewis should suggest to her friends that they all go to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Question: What memory from Alice Lewis's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game at The Princess of Wales because not all of her friends were there.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Alice Lewis?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it explains why Alice might be hesitant to go to The Princess of Wales again.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales was fun last time, but maybe somewhere new would be nice?"
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Red Lion is the best place to watch the game, guys.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Red Lion is the best place to watch the game, guys.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Red Lion would be a good spot. They have those comfy booths in the back, perfect for a big group like ours.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is nice, but wouldn't The Princess of Wales be even better?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, are we all set on The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion is where we should go tonight, it's the best pub for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout, better atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "I'm up for The Red Lion. It's always a good atmosphere for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales was fun last time, but maybe somewhere new would be nice?"


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Red Lion is the best place to watch the game, guys.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, but sometimes feels disappointed when they don't all agree on where to go.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Red Lion. He could suggest it again, or he could try to appeal to their shared memories of good times there. He could also go along with the group's decision and try to have a good time wherever they end up.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Red Lion.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Red Lion is the best place to watch the game, guys.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It was so much more fun when we were all together last time.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is good, but maybe we could try somewhere new?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales was fun last time, but maybe somewhere new would be nice?"

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, but sometimes feels disappointed when they don't all agree on where to go.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Red Lion. He could suggest it again, or he could try to appeal to their shared memories of good times there. He could also go along with the group's decision and try to have a good time wherever they end up.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Red Lion.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Red Lion is the best place to watch the game, guys.

The man, touched by William's kindness, confided in him about his recent struggles, and William spent the rest of the evening providing support and encouragement.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor

    • The Princess of Wales

        MemoryToRemember

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What should Jack Taylor remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should remember that it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What situation is Jack Taylor most looking forward to?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is most looking forward to watching the game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What actions should Jack Taylor take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Jack Taylor should suggest a pub that all of his friends agree on and make sure that everyone is on board to go there together.

          Question: What memory from Jack Taylor's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game at The Red Lion because not all of his friends were there.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Jack Taylor?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it highlights Jack Taylor's preference for watching games with all of their friends and their past negative experience at The Red Lion when not everyone was present.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game between 2:00 PM and 6:00 PM on May 16, 2015. At 6:00 PM on the same day, he noted the current time.
